Every stride, every milestone, is a testament to the incredible potential within us. Let's celebrate our achievements, big and small, and inspire others to reach for their own goals.
Happy International Women's Day! ✨

Looking for datasets (beyond Kaggle) ? 
Here's a curated list to guide you:

1) Learn web scraping, and create your own data! i do this for personal projects even though it might be difficult to start, it's just that much rewarding!
libraries you might need : selenium/ beautifulsoup/ scrapy. Learn some xpath, css selectors and basic html too!
2) google it - this might seem obvious, but learn to search properly and you might actually find very useful things
3) there's a github repo with a LOT of datasets, link https://lnkd.in/eqiZWZNE
4) a website called components has good datasets too:
https://lnkd.in/e6ACGPAs
5) kdnuggets:
https://lnkd.in/eibhGzuC
6) open data inception:
https://lnkd.in/eCP_P2xK
7) opendatasoft:
https://lnkd.in/eMRbxM3U
8) databar
https://databar.ai/
9) gov data websites:
https://us.gov/
https://data.gov.in/
10) google's search engine for datasets https://lnkd.in/er_NUXW6 
11) reddit has some datasets too!
https://lnkd.in/eCZci-Nh - check the
"data" section of the sidebar
12)OSF HOME:
https://osf.io/
13) an article on links to good datasets ( health DataSets)
https://lnkd.in/etwU3THG
14) research papers!
when i wanted some aero data I typed on google scholar « Aero data ». I then went onto relevant papers, and typed things like "data collection","data source", "repository" etc. this gave me an idea on how other people were collecting data, and i was so happy to find alternate sources/ways of collecting data.
15) UCI's machine learning repository:
https://lnkd.in/eDgWAyBW
16) Similar to the above link, many research labs keep working on datasets. Stanford, for example has : 
https://lnkd.in/es57yC5Y
17) make your own dataset using faker's library
https://lnkd.in/e9bs26c7
18) Hugging face:
This has great datasets to work with as well.
https://lnkd.in/e7Ry_jJS
19) adding json to any subreddit will display the data on it. This is something I just found about, and it absolutely blew me away.
20) Academic Torrents:
https://lnkd.in/e7FDedk9
21) YouTube-8M Segments Dataset
https://lnkd.in/ec3KW2b8
22) Open Street Map!
https://lnkd.in/eeqe8pug
I hope this served you well!
#datasets #data #datascience #machinelearning #artificialintelligence #kaggle #github

🚀 Le 7 novembre dernier a marqué le lancement de la troisième édition du programme MENTOR’IA.

🟣 Cette année la "promo" s'agrandit avec 20 étudiantes en licence et/ou master qui vont pouvoir bénéficier d’un accompagnement personnalisé avec un ou une professionnel.le de l’IA, issu(e) des mondes académique ou industriel.

🟣 Le mentorat leur permettra d’obtenir des conseils pour démarrer une carrière dans le numérique, et se créer un réseau qui les accompagnera pour leur entrée sur le marché du travail.

💬 "Depuis plusieurs années dans les programmes stratégiques utilisant l'IA et plus généralement dans les projets de Recherche et Développement, il apparait clairement que la sous-représentativité des femmes en science constitue un frein à l'applicabilité et à l'utilisation pleine et entière de l'IA. ANITI est pour moi un écosystème privilégié et reconnu pour apporter un soutien aux futures générations de scientifiques et notamment encourager et supporter les membres féminines qui souhaitent embrasser une trajectoire IA" - Carine AMELINE, PhD - Mentor

#ANITI I #IA I #Mentorat I Marjorie Allain-Moulet I Corinne Joffre I Dennis G Wilson

Delighted to be part of the Mentor’IA program as a mentor within ANITI Toulouse (Artificial Natural Intelligence Toulouse Institut).

Pursuing AI

Hey Now that I'm done with my master's degree (Yes! graduated with high honors) and staying at home, I've got some extra time. I want to talk about something I really care about: Artificial Intelligence.
As I'm looking for jobs, I've noticed more and more people getting into AI (300+ candidates for every job offer ) just because it's popular or for the money (data scientist being the sexiest job of the 21st century) , without really loving the subject. So, here's my simple advice:
If you don't truly love AI, if you don't feel really excited about it about new technologies and new advancements, maybe think about your choice. If you're only after money ( that doesn't mean work for free don't get me wrong!), you might end up unhappy because the field is getting really crowded. Ask yourself, would you still do it for fun if you didn't get paid? Your answer matters.

Remember why you started this journey and find joy in it



#ArtificialIntelligence #TechnologyForGood #ContinuousLearning

The AI gold rush is sweeping the business world, as enterprises scramble to adopt AI solutions in a race for competitive advantage. However, the hasty integration of AI can lead to disastrous outcomes if robust considerations are overlooked. Building a strong data infrastructure and addressing ethical and regulatory compliance are often sacrificed in the quest for quick implementation. Without ensuring model interpretability and continuous monitoring, the black box nature of AI algorithms can undermine transparency and accountability. Neglecting skill development and collaboration further exacerbates the problem. Only by adopting a thoughtful and robust approach can enterprises truly harness the potential of AI to drive sustainable growth and success, avoiding the pitfalls that lie within the AI frenzy.
#ThoughtfulAIIntegration #EthicalAI #ContinuousMonitoring
#AIRegulatoryCompliance

Today especially with the High school graduation results in Tunisia (Le fameux Bac) and people asking me about careers after high school (Est-ce que choisir l'informatique est une décision judicieuse si je n'aime pas vraiment ça / J'ai peur de faire le mauvais choix... ) , I want to address a topic that many of us, especially young professionals, grapple with: the pressure to have our lives figured out at a young age. 

Society bombards us with expectations, suggesting that we should have a clear career path, a solid plan, and all the answers by the time we reach our twenties. But here's the truth: life is a beautiful, messy, and unpredictable journey, and it's okay not to have it all figured out. Even if it seems that everybody got everything figured out .

I speak from personal experience who has felt the weight of these expectations. However, I have come to realize that embracing the journey and allowing ourselves the space to explore, grow, and make mistakes is an invaluable part of our personal and professional development. It’s not a problem if you do not like the job you’ve been dying to have you still have plenty of time to change and restart again.

We need to shift the narrative and acknowledge that finding our purpose and carving our path is a process that unfolds over time. It's about embracing the uncertainties, taking risks, and being open to new opportunities that may lead us in unexpected and fulfilling directions. Instead of succumbing to the pressure, let's cultivate resilience and adaptability. let's remember that success is subjective and unique to each individual. It's not defined by a predetermined timeline or societal expectations. It's about finding fulfillment and happiness in the journey, rather than reaching a specific destination.

So, to all the young professionals out there feeling the weight of the world's expectations, I encourage you to embrace the uncertainty, trust the process, and be kind to yourself. You are not alone in this journey, and it's okay not to have all the answers right now. Allow yourself the freedom to explore, experiment, and discover your true passions. There is no Timeline for that .

Together, let's redefine success and support one another as we navigate the beautiful chaos of life. Let's celebrate the small victories, embrace the detours, and remind ourselves that the journey is just as important as the destination if not BETTER.
#EmbraceTheJourney #ThrivingYoungProfessionals #SuccessIsAJourney #ai #success #job #career #opportunities

Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 was recently announced confirmed by Microsoft to be a BRAND NEW SEQUEL (Its not an update) . I couldn't resist the urge to revisit the game and test the latest version. Having not touched it since my childhood, I was eager to see how far it had come, particularly in terms of AI integration. And let me tell you, I was absolutely blown away.

One aspect that truly astonished me was the seamless integration of the Air Traffic Control (ATC) system. The AI-controlled ATC controllers demonstrated remarkable precision and accuracy, effortlessly adapting to changing weather conditions, intricate flight plans, complex airspaces, and even aircraft condition. It was truly impressive to witness the AI's ability to provide realistic and responsive guidance to players. Achieving such accuracy is undoubtedly challenging, and I am keen to learn more about the underlying architecture behind the ATC system. I wonder if it leverages the power of data, incorporates an exceptional optimization algorithm, or employs a hybrid approach.

Furthermore, I must acknowledge the significant role of Azure's integration in enhancing the overall experience. The use of AI Speech Generation technology for the flight controller voices resulted in human-like voices that made me question whether voice actors were involved at all.

I can't contain my excitement for the release of Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024. The opportunity to explore the vast skies, with the game's emphasis on different aviation professions and its ability to construct a detailed and realistic representation of our planet by processing an impressive 2.5 petabytes of Bing Maps satellite photo data through Azure machine learning, is something I eagerly anticipate.

#MicrosoftFlightSimulator2024 #AIIntegration #AviationProfessions #ATCIntegration #ImmersiveGaming #aviation #machinelearning #ai #azure

What is Adversarial Validation In Machine Learning? 

This year as part of a class we had to compete at the Defi-IA , a prominent French competition, presented an exciting challenge that went beyond the creation of AI models. Participants had the  opportunity to work with an API designed for this challenge for data retrieval, considering various strategies and addressing potential biases. The Defi-IA experience emphasized the significance of addressing biases and distributional differences when working with external data sources .It was an exhilarating journey that ultimately led us to the utilization of adversarial validation. 

So, what exactly is adversarial validation? Inspired by FastML's concept, it revolves around assessing the similarity between training and test data in terms of feature distribution. By validating the degree of similarity, we can uncover potential discrepancies and avoid overfitting, ultimately improving our model's performance. It's a simple yet powerful approach to understand the variables that influence our dataset. 

While initially faced with challenges in aligning the API data with the test dataset and securing higher leaderboard positions, adversarial validation emerged as a turning point in our journey. It bridged the gap between our model's performance and the test dataset, offering valuable insights and enabling us to refine our approaches. However, we acknowledge that the effectiveness of adversarial validation in competition settings may differ when applied to real-life datasets, necessitating careful consideration.  

It's rather essential to recognize the limitations of adversarial validation, particularly its potential to overfit to the adversarial data and compromise generalization capabilities. Striking the right balance between addressing biases and maintaining model performance on real-world data remains crucial for data scientists. 

Let's engage in meaningful discussions about the merits and limitations of adversarial validation if you did use it before, both in competition settings and real-life datasets, to uncover new strategies and push the boundaries of what's possible. 

#AdversarialValidation #KaggleCompetitions #DataScience #MachineLearning #BiasInData #RealLifeDatasets #DefiIA #Insights #Collaboration

Defending Machine Learning Models Against Adversarial Attacks: Safeguarding in the Cyber Age 

In today's technology-driven world, machine learning models have become integral to various domains. However, these models are not immune to manipulation. Adversarial attacks have emerged as a significant concern, exploiting vulnerabilities in machine learning systems. Let's explore the realm of adversarial attacks and defenses, shedding light on these concepts and strategies to safeguard our models. 🛡️

Adversarial attacks involve intentional manipulation of input data to deceive machine learning models. Crafted with precision, adversarial examples mislead models into making incorrect predictions. These examples closely resemble legitimate data but contain carefully engineered perturbations. Adversarial attacks pose a threat to the security and integrity of machine learning systems, necessitating the need for robust defenses.
To counter this rising threat, researchers have been actively developing defense strategies. Here are some prominent approaches:

1️⃣ Adversarial Training: Augmenting the training dataset with adversarial examples, models are exposed to manipulated data during training. This process enables them to recognize and counter such attacks, enhancing their robustness and generalization to unseen adversarial examples.
2️⃣ Defensive Distillation: Instead of hard labels, models are trained using soft labels—probabilities assigned to different classes. This nuanced understanding of data makes models more resilient to adversarial perturbations, making it difficult for attackers to exploit vulnerabilities.
3️⃣ Input Preprocessing: Employing various preprocessing techniques, such as filtering out high-frequency noise or utilizing denoising algorithms, helps detect and remove adversarial perturbations. These methods aid in cleaning input data and reducing the impact of manipulative attacks.

As machine learning models continue to play a significant role in our lives, addressing their vulnerabilities to adversarial attacks is crucial. Such attacks undermine trust, reliability, and security. By implementing defense mechanisms we can enhance the resilience of machine learning models against adversaries.
The field of adversarial attacks and defenses is continuously evolving, and researchers are actively exploring new techniques. Protecting machine learning models from adversarial attacks remains an ongoing challenge in the cybersecurity domain. Let's stay vigilant, advance research, and implement robust defense mechanisms to pave the way for safer and more secure machine learning systems in the cyber age. 🌐
#MachineLearning #Cybersecurity #AdversarialAttacks #DefenseStrategies #DataSecurity

Beyond the Binary: Being Both a Musician and an Engineer 

When I stepped into the engineering world, people assumed that music was just a hobby for me—a mere escape from the logical confines of science .Similarly, when I immersed myself in the music world from a professional point of view, pursuing my passion for Music, no one believed that I was also a passionate AI practitioner. The surprise on their faces when they discovered my deep love for engineering and artificial intelligence was palpable. I found myself constantly categorized, with questions like, "Are you more of a musician or an engineer?"

But life doesn't have to be a choice between one path or the other. It doesn't mean that all I will ever do is build AI models. Someday, I may find myself at the very center of a music career. For years until now all I do is try to juggle both worlds.

People tend to give you dedicated roles, labeling science as your "work" and music as your "passion." But to me, this differentiation between science and arts has always seemed absurd. I found rigor and discipline in the arts, while my scientific pursuits sparked imagination and creativity. Science and art were interwoven, complementary forces in my life The two realms coexist and thrive within me.

If you find  yourself straddling multiple paths, whether it's sketching alongside your engineering career or pursuing sports while nurturing another passion, I encourage you to embrace both. You are not simply an engineer or a painter, a musician or a doctor. You are BOTH You are a multi-faceted individual with diverse talents and passions. Each aspect of your identity is valid and impressive. Do not let the pressure of societal expectations force you to choose one over the other.

There is a prevailing notion that academia discourages pursuing side interests, arguing that one should focus solely on studying to secure a "real" job. But in my eyes, that perspective is nothing more than misguided. I firmly believe that you should do both—pursue your passions alongside your academic pursuits. If it weren't for music, I wouldn't be as proficient in my engineering career and studies. And if it weren't for my engineering endeavors, my musical abilities would not have reached their fullest potential.

So, let go of the notion that you have to fit into a single mold. Embrace the fusion of your passions. Break the barriers between science and art. Explore the uncharted territories where music and AI converge. Allow your diverse interests to shape and amplify your journey. By integrating your passions, you will discover a profound sense of fulfillment and unleash your true potential. 
Embrace your multifaceted identity, and don't let anyone diminish the significance of either realm. You are both —an embodiment of the powerful synergy between science and art.

#MusicAndAI #PassionAndInnovation #ScienceAndArt #EmbraceYourPassions #artificialintelligence #work #engineering #art #career

Physical Informed Neural Networks (#PINNs): Uniting Machine Learning and Physics Bridging the Gap Between Theory and Real-World Applications

As a researcher or engineer, you are likely familiar with the challenges of solving complex physical problems that require knowledge of underlying physical phenomena. Traditional numerical methods can be computationally expensive and may not be suitable for problems with limited data or poorly understood physics. However, Physical Informed #NeuralNetworks (#PINNs) provide a novel approach to differential equation solving that offers significant advantages over traditional methods. It might not always work but it’s also worth the try . 
#PINNs use deep neural networks to approximate the solution of differential equations. The neural network architecture is designed to incorporate physical knowledge and constraints, enabling it to generalize well to new data and handle noisy or incomplete information.#PINNs can also reduce computational costs by learning to solve the differential equations directly, without requiring a discretization of the domain. 
To improve the performance of #PINNs, here are some hints and tricks to keep in mind:
1-Choose the right #network architecture: The choice of network architecture can have a significant impact on the performance of PINNs. For example, residual networks can help avoid vanishing gradients, while attention-based networks can help focus on important regions of the input.
2-Incorporate #physics-informed loss functions: PINNs can benefit from incorporating physical knowledge into the loss function. This can be achieved by adding penalty terms that enforce conservation laws or other constraints that are known to hold in the problem domain.
3-Use adaptive learning rates: PINNs can be sensitive to the choice of learning rate. Using adaptive learning rate algorithms such as Adam or Adagrad can help improve convergence and avoid overfitting.
Regularize the network: PINNs can be prone to overfitting, especially when working with limited data. Regularization techniques such as dropout or weight decay can help improve generalization and prevent overfitting.

If you are interested in PINN’s and want to delve in the subject send me a message and I can send you some ressources and Jupiter notebooks to begin with ! #machinelearning #data #physics #modeling

The Secrets Behind Impressive Flight Tracking Patterns - #Traffic Library!

I have always been fascinated by the intricate flight patterns created by #aircraft. These patterns not only showcase the capabilities of modern aviation but also demonstrate the incredible skill of #pilots. During my #research, I was thrilled to discover the Traffic library in #Python, which allowed me to delve deeper into these patterns and gain a greater understanding of the factors that influence them.

If you're interested in exploring some fun #flight #patterns, you should check out the #Airbus "Christmas Tree" flight in 2019 that was designed to test the capabilities of their new #A380 aircraft. The flight path, which resembled a Christmas tree on the map, covered a distance of over 3,000 kilometers. By using the Traffic library and searching for the callsign AIB232E and aircraft 3807fa, you can explore this flight trajectory in great detail, analyzing factors such as altitude, speed, and direction to gain insights into the precision required to create such a complex flight pattern.
Another impressive flight tracking pattern was created by Air Malta during a special occasion when two of their employees were married. An #airplane was used to draw two hearts in the #sky, a beautiful and unique gesture that delighted many.

The Traffic library is a fantastic find for anyone interested in #Aviation. It provides the ability to find #flight phases on a trajectory, all the airspaces crossed by a trajectory, select go-arounds or runway changes from a set of #trajectories, compute the top of climb/top of descent of a trajectory, infer a #flight #plan from a trajectory, estimate the fuel burnt by an aircraft,among other features So if you are interested don’t hesitate to play with it . 

By using this library, you can gain a deeper understanding of the modern #aviation industry's capabilities, the skill of pilots, and appreciate the beauty of flight patterns in a whole new way. So go ahead and give it a try!

If you're ready to get started, head to https://lnkd.in/ddgEGRcy #aviationindustry

Embrace your Geekiness: Why Girls Should Consider STEM Careers

STEM (science, technology, engineering, and math) fields offer some of the most exciting and impactful areas of work in our society today. However, despite the many benefits of #STEM careers, women are still significantly underrepresented in these fields. As someone who has worked in STEM fields, I can attest to the incredible contributions that women can make in these areas. But I've also seen the barriers that can make it difficult for #girls and #women to pursue STEM careers, from gender stereotypes and biased educational practices to a lack of role models. In some cases, individuals may dismiss females in STEM if they do not display a certain type of personality that is commonly associated with success in these fields. This can be particularly challenging for women who have worked hard to earn their place in the industry, but who may not conform to traditional stereotypes or expectations.

However, these barriers are not insurmountable. In fact, by breaking down these barriers and encouraging more girls to pursue STEM careers, we can create a better future for everyone. Here are just a few reasons why girls should consider a career in STEM:

1- You can make a real difference in the world: STEM fields offer endless opportunities to make a positive impact on the world around us. Whether you're working on developing new technologies to fight disease, finding ways to mitigate the effects of climate change, or creating innovative solutions to social problems, STEM careers are all about making a difference in the world.

2- You'll be part of a community: The STEM community is a supportive and collaborative one. You'll have the opportunity to work with and learn from a diverse group of people who share your passion for #science and #technology. Plus, you'll be part of a movement to break down gender and racial barriers in these fields and create a more diverse and inclusive industry.

3- You'll be challenged: #STEM careers offer constant challenges and opportunities for growth. You'll never stop learning and developing new skills, which will keep your work exciting and fulfilling.

And let's not forget the fun factor! Working with boys in STEM fields can also be a blast. Sure, you may have to put up with a few Dad jokes, but you'll also have access to endless puns, memes that pop up from nowhere in your group chat that will keep your workday entertaining. Plus, as the STEM community becomes more inclusive, there's never been a better time for girls to break down barriers and make their mark in this exciting and rewarding field. So, embrace your geekiness and pursue your passion for science and technology - the world needs more girls like you!
#GirlsInTech #EmbraceYourGeekiness #scienceandtechnology

Laughing My Way to Conquering Imposter Syndrome

You know the feeling that you're not good enough or that you don't belong? Yep, that's Imposter Syndrome, and let me tell you, it's a doozy. 

But here's the thing, acknowledging the fact that everyone, even the ones you admire, has self-doubts can help you conquer it. And one way to do that is by laughing at yourself.
I used to think I was an imposter too, until I learned to laugh it up whenever I felt that way. By taking a step back and finding the humor in my self-doubts, I was able to realize that it's all just a part of the process.
And then I started to approach everything I did as a passion. Whether it was my #work, my #hobbies, or my relationships, I found something to be passionate about and dove in headfirst. This included my approach to school as well, although it might be controversial to say that I didn't take it as seriously as some people did.

When I started pursuing what I wanted to do in life. I thought to myself as a 16 years old , "Who am I to pursue this? I don't have the qualifications or experience that other people in the field have." But then I realized that what I lacked in qualifications, I made up for in #passion and if it didn’t work at least I made it fun.

Now, I'm not saying that #ImposterSyndrome magically disappeared overnight. But I've learned to embrace it, to laugh at its ridiculousness, and to use it as fuel to propel me forward.

By shifting my vision and approaching everything as a passion, I was able to get out of the imposter mood that every student goes through, especially in university. I gave up on competition and started focusing on my personal growth, and the results were amazing. I found myself succeeding more and more, and enjoying (most of the time) the journey.

So, let's all take a deep breath and acknowledge the fact that we are all works in progress. Imposter Syndrome is something that we all go through, but by laughing at ourselves and approaching everything with passion, we can conquer it.
Have you ever felt Imposter Syndrome ? Share your experience and let's demistify it 
#ImposterSyndrome #ConquerTheWorld #LaughAtYourself #ApproachWithPassion

"Flying High with Preference Learning: The Art of Predicting Choices"

Have you ever considered the complexity of decision-making and its impact on our lives, from choosing what to eat for lunch (It's like a never-ending game of "What's for lunch?" .Shoutout to all moms when they used to make that choice for us) to the significant choices affecting our careers, relationships, and health? Decision-making is a critical aspect of our daily lives and can be influenced by personal preferences, past experiences, societal norms, and emotions. Making informed decisions based on objective criteria rather than biases is essential to our well-being, especially in sensitive fields. This is where preference learning comes into play.

Preference learning is a process that predicts the choices individuals make based on their preferences. I have been exploring this approach in the aviation and space industry, and it has the potential to revolutionize decision-making. By analyzing the preferences of pilots, astronauts, and passengers, we can gain insights into their decision-making and make more informed choices.
However, preference learning is not without its controversies. First question Raised is how accurately could it be predicting human preferences on data that may be inherently biased. Additionally, it may lead to a lack of transparency and accountability, making it challenging to understand how decisions are being made especially in very stressful situations and emergencies in cockpits for example.

Preference learning is a fascinating and technical approach, I’ve been exploring it a bit lately using preference statements integrated in decision trees such as Constraint-based decision tree In this approach, the preference statements are used as constraints to restrict the decision tree from making certain decisions that are not preferred. For example, if the preference statement is that a decision should not exceed a certain cost or time limit, then the decision tree algorithm can be modified to exclude decision paths that violate this constraint or Penalty-based decision tree In this approach, the preference statements are used as penalties to discourage the decision tree from making certain decisions that are not preferred. For example, if the preference statement is that a decision should minimize a certain cost or maximize a certain benefit, then the decision tree algorithm can be modified to penalize decision paths that do not satisfy this preference.

Let's dive into the #technical and especially the #ethical aspects of #PreferenceLearning and discuss its potential as a #gamechanger for decision-making in fields like aviation and space industry. But also, let's not forget the concerns about #bias and lack of #transparency and #accountability. Join the conversation! #DecisionMaking #DataScience #AI #MachineLearning #preferencelearning

Is Data-Driven AI Overrated? Are We Forgetting Something? 

After reflecting on my experience as an #AI practitioner over the past few months, I have gained a deeper understanding of the significant role that model-driven AI plays in building successful AI #systems. This realization is particularly important in industries such as #aerospace, where #safety is of utmost importance, and model #explainability is a critical aspect of the #work. 

While the industry has made great strides in #data-driven AI due to advancements in neural net algorithms, data storage, and fast processors, it's essential not to overlook the benefits of #model-driven AI. Symbolic AI attempts to capture knowledge and derive decisions through explicit representation and rules, making it ideal for highly codified domains where knowledge can be captured in a model.

The question, therefore, is whether there are situations that are a good fit for explicit models and whether we can have systems that are purely model or data-driven or whether we gain more from combining the two. It is essential to appreciate what a structured AI model brings to the table to effectively combine different AI tools. Without a software engineering paradigm specifically focused on AI #software, we risk missing out on useful tooling and reinventing the wheel repeatedly.

So how can we effectively combine different AI tools to achieve the best results? The answer lies in the combination of data-driven and model-driven AI. By appreciating what a structured AI model brings to the table, we can integrate it with the latest data-driven AI techniques and tools to create more effective and impactful AI solutions.

By integrating the best of both worlds, we can leverage the power of data-driven AI techniques to extract value from vast amounts of data and combine it with model-driven AI to capture explicit knowledge and derive decisions through explicit representation and rules.

One of the benefits of a hybrid model in AI is improved accuracy and explainability. While data-driven AI techniques can provide accurate predictions and insights, they often lack #transparency . Model-driven AI, on the other hand, provides a transparent and interpretable framework for #decision  making, allowing us to understand how decisions are made and why certain actions were taken. By combining the two approaches, we can achieve both #accuracy and #transparency, making it easier to understand and interpret the #results .
Also by incorporating model-driven AI, we can reduce the amount of irrelevant information and false positives, resulting in a more efficient and effective system.

To do so, we need to have a software engineering paradigm that's specifically focused on AI #software. By building a strong foundation for #AI #development and deployment, we can ensure that we're leveraging AI in the best possible way.

To all the #AI #practitioners out there share your #thoughts and #experiences in the comments below.

My first step working in #artificialintelligence in the Aeronautical world as a #datascientist intern at #airbus , working on future technologies and concepts in the #cockpit of #NewGeneration #Aircrafts.

Being able to work on #aeronautics decision making (ADM) and to play a part in its development is amazing. It is truly exciting to be part of a project that has the potential to revolutionize the way #pilots interact with the #cockpit plus I get to hangout with #planes and try #simulators so WIN WIN.

As someone who has always been fascinated by #airplanes and #aviation, and happily waited as kid for planes to go above my head I couldn't think of a more perfect compromise between #work and #passion I enjoy spending my days surrounded by #planes, learning about the latest #technology from my amazing team and supervisor, and being part of a team that is shaping the future of #aviation and is also fun to be around.

Hopefully, I'll be able to share my insights and experiences with you all along the way on the unique challenges and rewards that come with integrating #AI into aircraft #design and #operations. Stay tuned!
